paragraphs.context: Netcool/OMNIbus; NCOMS ; gateway; netcool/gateway; netauth; hsql; database; db; hsqldb; pwd; passphrase; password; sysadmin; sys; admin; system administration; security; sec; authorization; authorisation; risk; vulnerability; modify; edit; update TECHNOTE (FAQ) ISSUE The standard password doesn't meet the organization's security protocols. REASONThe default password is not set.EXPLANATIONFollowing the third-party software documentation, the HSQLDB command line tools include:  *  * SET PASSWORD *  *  * SET PASSWORD <password>; *  *  * This modifies the password of the connected user at the moment. Password must be enclosed in double quotation marks. "" can be used to set an empty password.As an example of modifying the password in HSQLDB, by connecting to the database:  *  *  *  *  * and executing the command:  * quit:  * and logging back in with the new password:  *  *  *  *  * The aforementioned example uses the default OmniServer name (NCO) and HSQLDB port number (5835). The default password is unset. It will be necessary to tweak the HSQLDB DataSource to make it connect to the database with the new password. A) One way is by encrypting the password and tweaking the HSQLDB DataSource to permit DSA connection. Use nco_crypt to encrypt the password - for instance:  *  *  * modify the document:  * to modify the property:  * from the default value of {aes}9C71E0F544E705326E2B5CBDFC54CE46 to the new encrypted password value - for instance:  * This needs an OmniServer restart to take effect. B) Another way is to modify the DataSource through the usual Omni configuration GUI and input the new password there. This method has the benefit that you don't need to perform the encryption yourself, nor do you need to manually edit the configuration document and nor does one need to do an OmniServer restart to load the new configuration into the in-memory database that is the OmniServer.

paragraphs.context:
NEWS UPDATE: The Strategic Position of IBM Cloud Orchestrator in Hybrid Cloud Management

IBM Cloud Orchestrator continues to retain its central role in hybrid cloud management strategies for IBM. There are ongoing developments envisioned for future releases of IBM Cloud Orchestrator, particularly to bolster management of compliant RefStack certification external OpenStack environments. This initiative offers more flexibility and choice for clients to choose their preferred OpenStack vendor.

As for the current version of IBM Cloud Orchestrator, the bundle with IBM Cloud Manager with OpenStack (ICMO) will proceed. However, subsequent IBM Cloud Orchestrator releases will omit this bundle. This change follows an announcement that ICMO is soon reaching its market life expectancy. 

Nevertheless, IBM assures continued support for IBM Cloud Orchestrator (ICO) and IBM Cloud Manager with OpenStack (ICMO) up until September 2020. More information regarding the end of market announcement for ICMO can be found through the link listed below.

Reference: ICMO End of Market Announcement: http://www-01.ibm.com/common/ssi/ShowDoc.wss?docURL=/common/ssi/rep_ca/2/897/ENUS916-062/index.html&lang=en&request_locale=en.

qas.question: What problem was encountered with the IBM Data Server Client application?

answers.text: IBM Data Server Client application cannot run correctly due to missing configuration file.

qas.question: What was the cause of the problem?

answers.text: Inexperience with the file system may have resulted in accidental deletion or misplacement of the configuration file.

qas.question: What manifests as a symptom of the problem?

answers.text: Unsuccessful launch of the IBM Data Server Client application

qas.question: How should I go about resolving this problem?

answers.text:
Close the IBM Data Server Client application if it's currently open. 
2. Ensure you have a backup of the following file location:
   C:\ProgramData\IBM\DataServer\Client\Configuration 
   Note: C:\ProgramData may be hidden by default. To reveal, go to Folder and Search options > View tab > Hidden files and folders > Show hidden files, folders, and drives. 
3. If a backup is available, copy the backup and replace in the directory above.
   If no backup exists, proceed to the next step.
4. Uninstall IBM Data Server Client application using Add or Remove Programs from the control panel.  
5. Reinstall IBM Data Server Client application with correct configuration settings. 
6. Start the IBM Data Server application.

qas.question: What additional information is related to this problem?

answers.text: IBM Data Server Information Center [http://ibm.biz/dsclient_info].

paragraphs.context:
TECHNOTE (TROUBLESHOOTING)
PROBLEM(ABSTRACT)
IBM Data Server Client application cannot run correctly due to missing configuration file. 

SYMPTOM
Unsuccessful launch of the IBM Data Server Client application

CAUSE 
Inexperience with the file system may have resulted in accidental deletion or misplacement of the configuration file.

RESOLVING THE PROBLEM 
1. Close the IBM Data Server Client application if it's currently open. 
2. Ensure you have a backup of the following file location:
   C:\ProgramData\IBM\DataServer\Client\Configuration 
   Note: C:\ProgramData may be hidden by default. To reveal, go to Folder and Search options > View tab > Hidden files and folders > Show hidden files, folders, and drives. 
3. If a backup is available, copy the backup and replace in the directory above.
   If no backup exists, proceed to the next step.
4. Uninstall IBM Data Server Client application using Add or Remove Programs from the control panel.  
5. Reinstall IBM Data Server Client application with correct configuration settings. 
6. Start the IBM Data Server application. 

RELATED INFORMATION 
IBM Data Server Information Center [http://ibm.biz/dsclient_info].

qas.question: What can be done to manage the increasing size of the DBMSINFO database in DBMS for Net 6.0.1?

answers.text: To maintain only the latest 24 hours of data every day (regular management), you can arrange a daily task to operate the dbmsTrimDB2db utility provided.

qas.question: Is there an automated mechanism to prune the DBMSINFO database in the older version DBMS for Net 6.0.1?

answers.text: In relation to the older version DBMS for Net 6.0.1, there isn't an automated mechanism to periodically manage or prune the DBMSINFO database.

qas.question: What's the situation with newer versions of DBMS for Net in relation to managing the DBMSINFO database?

answers.text: As for the newer DBMS for Net 7.0, a cleanup task is integrated that operates on the TIP host where the DBMSINFO database is installed.

qas.question: What happens to the SYSMETRICS and DATAINFO table rows that date back more than 24 hours in the newer DBMS for Net 7.0?

answers.text: It deletes SYSMETRICS and DATAINFO table rows where STARTIME (start of period) dates back more than 24 hours.

qas.question: How are the two tables that contribute majorly to DBMSINFO's storage usage managed in the newer version of DBMS for Net?

answers.text: Consequently, these two tables, which majorly contribute to DBMSINFO storage usage, should not indefinitely increase in size.

paragraphs.context:
DBMSMETRICS DBMSALL DBMSAPERF SYSMETRICS DATAINFO TechSupportDoc (FAQ)QUESTION Is there a way to manage the steadily increasing size of the DBMSINFO database?

ANSWER In relation to the older version DBMS for Net 6.0.1, there isn't an automated mechanism to periodically manage or prune the DBMSINFO database. However, there is a relevant Wiki page on this subject: https://www.ibm.com/developerworks/community/wikis/home?lang=en#!/wiki/Tivoli+Integrated+Portal/page/Managing+DBMS+Data+Volume+Tables [https://www.ibm.com/developerworks/community/wikis/home?lang=en#!/wiki/Tivoli+Integrated+Portal/page/Managing+DBMS+Data+Volume+Tables]

To maintain only the latest 24 hours of data every day (regular management), you can arrange a daily task to operate the dbmsTrimDB2db utility provided. As for the newer DBMS for Net 7.0, a cleanup task is integrated that operates on the TIP host where the DBMSINFO database is installed. It deletes SYSMETRICS and DATAINFO table rows where STARTIME (start of period) dates back more than 24 hours. Consequently, these two tables, which majorly contribute to DBMSINFO storage usage, should not indefinitely increase in size.

NOTE: Please bear in mind that DBMS for Net 6.0.1 is No-Longer-Supported since May 10, 2015.

qas.question: Why isn't the Batch Processing and Real-Time Data Sync functionality working properly?

answers.text: The user guide mentions a BATCH_JOB_SCHEDULER and REAL_TIME_DATA_SYNC component that should be located under the DATA_MANAGEMENT_CONFIGURATION. It should be noted that these specific parameters aren't set up by default during the database setup process.

qas.question: What could cause the Batch Processing and Real-Time Data Sync functionality to not work properly?

answers.text: these specific parameters aren't set up by default during the database setup process.

qas.question: How can I enable the Batch Processing and Real-Time Data Sync functionalities?

answers.text: you can manually insert these component parameters.

qas.question: What steps need to be followed to set up the BATCH_JOB_SCHEDULER and REAL_TIME_DATA_SYNC parameters?

answers.text:
1. Navigate to Admin > Components.
2. Locate the DATA_MANAGEMENT_CONFIGURATION component.
3. Click on the "Edit" option.
4. Select "Add Parameter".  
5. Assign the 'name' as "BATCH_JOB_SCHEDULER" and 'value' as either "True" or "False" based on your functional requirement.
6. Again, select "Add Parameter".
7. Name this new parameter as "REAL_TIME_DATA_SYNC" and attach a value either "True" or "False" aligned with your operational needs.
8. Choose "Save and Close" to apply these adjustments.

qas.question: Where should the BATCH_JOB_SCHEDULER and REAL_TIME_DATA_SYNC component be located?

answers.text: BATCH_JOB_SCHEDULER and REAL_TIME_DATA_SYNC component that should be located under the DATA_MANAGEMENT_CONFIGURATION.

paragraphs.context:
TECHNOTE (GUIDE)
QUESTION: Why isn't the Batch Processing and Real-Time Data Sync functionality working properly?
CAUSE: The user guide mentions a BATCH_JOB_SCHEDULER and REAL_TIME_DATA_SYNC component that should be located under the DATA_MANAGEMENT_CONFIGURATION. It should be noted that these specific parameters aren't set up by default during the database setup process.

SOLUTION: To enable the Batch Processing and Real-Time Data Sync functionalities, you can manually insert these component parameters. Follow these steps to set it up:

1. Navigate to Admin > Components.
2. Locate the DATA_MANAGEMENT_CONFIGURATION component.
3. Click on the "Edit" option.
4. Select "Add Parameter".  
5. Assign the 'name' as "BATCH_JOB_SCHEDULER" and 'value' as either "True" or "False" based on your functional requirement.
6. Again, select "Add Parameter".
7. Name this new parameter as "REAL_TIME_DATA_SYNC" and attach a value either "True" or "False" aligned with your operational needs.
8. Choose "Save and Close" to apply these adjustments.

paragraphs.context:
Java Enterprise Edition Performance Monitoring and Sampling Adjustment Guide 

FAQ DOCUMENT IS APPLICABLE TO THE FOLLOWING LANGUAGE VERSION(S): English US 

QUESTION: What steps should I undertake to revise the default Performance Monitoring Level and Sampling Rate in the current Java Enterprise Edition v7.1.1.0.0 agent? 

ANSWER: Unlike the earlier released Java (J2EE) agent (v6.2 FP6), you were given the liberty to signify the Performance Monitoring Level, Sampling Rate, and other parameters (baseline values, time periods etc.) during the configuration process of the agent. This option is currently unavailable in the new J2EE agent v7.1.1.0.0 set up panel. The Monitoring Level and Sampling Rate's default values are set at L1 and 2% respectively. Should you desire to permanently alter these default settings then please follow these instructions: 

In the $ITM_HOME/config (Unix) directory or the %ITM_HOME%\TMAITM6 (Windows), try locating the <hostname>_yj.xml file. Copy this file and then halt the agent to make changes to the parameters (refer to screenshot below) saved in the file. Save the adjustments, restart the agent. The agent will now have the new values configured. If you are setting up a new Weblogic application, stop the agent first, make necessary modifications in the <hostname>_yj_<wls_instance>.xml file and then restart the agent.

[/support/docview.wss?uid=swg21700308&aid=1] [/support/docview.wss?uid=swg21700308&aid=1] 

PRODUCT ALIAS/SYNONYM: ITCAM, ITCAM for Java Enterprise Edition, DC JBoss WebLogic.

TECHNOTE (SUPPORT FAQ)
QUESTION: Why can't I access the Splunk Web Interface from my browser?
CAUSE: This issue is typically due to an incorrect or missing hostname in the /etc/hosts file. Upon restarting the Splunk service, an error message might appear - can't determine fully qualified server domain name

qas.question: What is the problem that occurs with Oracle B2B Integrator?

answers.text: This Oracle PL/SQL error occurs with Oracle B2B Integrator: ORA-06550, Error in PL/SQL: PLS-00382.

qas.question: What exception is caused by this error?

answers.text: com.oraclecommerce.woodstock.profile.ProfileFinderException: listAllByEntityName: Finder Exception occurred: SQLState: ORA-06550 Message: Oracle PL/SQL error: ORA-06550, PLS-00382, SQLERRMC: nullVendor: ORA-06550.

qas.question: What is the cause of this problem?

answers.text: The Oracle instance did not have the full set of SGA components defined. DBA had manually created the System Gloabl Area components but excluded the shared pool and large pool.

qas.question: What is the resolution for this problem?

answers.text: The Oracle instance must have all the SGA (System Global Area) components defined: Database buffer cache, Redo log buffer, shared pool, java pool, large pool and streams pool. In addition to these, these must be set accordingly in the system and not as User defined components.

qas.question: What is the historical number of this issue?

answers.text: HISTORICAL NUMBER ORA26178SCI94737.

Right click on the menu Tools –> User Agent String. From this point, all views from this site will be displayed in Edge user agent string. You can also add the IP to the user agent string setting (refer to screenshot 2) by selecting Tools -> User Agent String Settings, after which the following dialog will open. Now, type the server IP address to add and click 'close' to save. [/support/docview.wss?uid=swg21988265&aid=2]Screenshot 2 Now, it's unnecessary to select the user agent string every time when Edge is started. Edge will automatically open the site in user agent string.

qas.question: What is the problem being discussed?

answers.text: ITM is relaying events to the EIF tool by the process of dispatching to the OMNIbus Server. User has reported that despite the event being transmitted as per the ITM logs, it is not recognized or identified by either the EIF or OMNIbus, and the original event is still visible in OMNIbus.

qas.question: What are the symptoms of the problem?

answers.text: Event status in ITM has been updated but the same event remains unaltered in OMNIbus.

qas.question: How is the problem diagnosed?

answers.text: From the iptrace analysis, it is clear that the EIF probe coordinating with the OMNIbus is shutting down (<RST>) the TCP/IP connection as soon as the event is received and it does not record in the EIF logs, resulting in the event dismissal.

qas.question: What is the proposed solution to the problem?

answers.text: The ideal remedy is to adjust the connection_mode in your om_tec.config on the ITM Server (TEMS) to shift from connection_oriented to connection_less.

qas.question: What should be done after modifying the om_tec.config file?

answers.text: Post this modification, a restart of the EIF on your ITM is necessary (using the command 'tacmd refreshTECinfo -t eif').

paragraphs.context:
om_tec.conf eif probe event dispatching to OMNIbus TECHNOTE (TROUBLESHOOTING) PROBLEM(ABSTRACT) ITM is relaying events to the EIF tool by the process of dispatching to the OMNIbus Server. User has reported that despite the event being transmitted as per the ITM logs, it is not recognized or identified by either the EIF or OMNIbus, and the original event is still visible in OMNIbus. 

SYMPTOMS
Event status in ITM has been updated but the same event remains unaltered in OMNIbus. 

DIAGNOSING THE PROBLEM
From the iptrace analysis, it is clear that the EIF probe coordinating with the OMNIbus is shutting down (<RST>) the TCP/IP connection as soon as the event is received and it does not record in the EIF logs, resulting in the event dismissal.

RESOLVING THE PROBLEM 
The ideal remedy is to adjust the connection_mode in your om_tec.config on the ITM Server (TEMS) to shift from connection_oriented to connection_less. 

Thus, the following line in your om_tec.config should be altered:

From - ConnectionMode=co
To - ConnectionMode=connection_less 

Post this modification, a restart of the EIF on your ITM is necessary (using the command 'tacmd refreshTECinfo -t eif').

qas.question: What is the issue with our Spring Boot application?

answers.text: Our Spring Boot application fails to generate an SSL connection with the following error message: ConnectionException: ECC premaster security issue.

qas.question: What is the cause of the ConnectionException?

answers.text: The core issue is with the default limited policy file, which includes a 2048 key size limit.

qas.question: What happens when the ECC key size crosses this limit?

answers.text: If the ECC key size crosses this limitation, then the error is expected.

qas.question: What is the suggested corrective action for this problem?

answers.text: The resolution to this issue involves an upgrade from the restricted policy files to unrestricted ones.

qas.question: What should the existing security policy files be replaced with?

answers.text: Swap the existing security policy files with Oracle's unlimited cryptography files. Supplant the local_policy.jar with the Unlimited Strength Jurisdiction Policy File.

paragraphs.context:
Spring Boot SSL ConnectionException - InvalidKeyException SOLUTION GUIDE (TROUBLESHOOTING)

ISSUE(SUMMARY)
Our Spring Boot application fails to generate an SSL connection with the following error message: ConnectionException: ECC premaster security issue. Rooted by: java.security.InvalidKeyException: Unrecognized key parameters or size.

SYMPTOM
java.net.ConnectionException: ECC premaster security issue. Triggered by: java.security.InvalidKeyException: Unrecognized key parameters or size

SOURCE OF ISSUE
The core issue is with the default limited policy file, which includes a 2048 key size limit. If the ECC key size crosses this limitation, then the error is expected.

SOLUTION CORRECTIVE ACTIONS
The resolution to this issue involves an upgrade from the restricted policy files to unrestricted ones. Swap the existing security policy files with Oracle's unlimited cryptography files. Supplant the local_policy.jar with the Unlimited Strength Jurisdiction Policy File. [https://www.oracle.com/java/technologies/javase-jce-all-downloads.html].

qas.question: What is the total number of threads allocated for standard Pollers across all three updates (v4.2, v4.3, & v4.4)?

answers.text: A total of 200 threads are allocated for standard Pollers across all three updates (v4.2, v4.3, & v4.4).

qas.question: Is the additional poller function implemented in all versions?

answers.text: The additional poller function is an upgrade implemented in v4.3 and subsequent versions

qas.question: Were extra Poller threads a feature in v4.2?

answers.text: extra Poller threads were not a feature in v4.2.

paragraphs.context:
Allocatable threads for apq_poller TECHNOTE (FAQ)

QUESTION 
What is the default number of threads allocated for the apq_poller system? Does the same quantity of threads apply for the extra Pollers as well?

ANSWER  
A total of 200 threads are allocated for standard Pollers across all three updates (v4.2, v4.3, & v4.4). The additional poller function is an upgrade implemented in v4.3 and subsequent versions, hence extra Poller threads were not a feature in v4.2. Yet, on creation of additional pollers in v4.3/v4.4, the same number of threads (i.e., 200) is allocated.

For v4.3, v4.4, the default quota of 200 can also be augmented by altering and uncommenting the following line in $APQHOME/etc/precision/ApqPollerSchema.cfg: //update config.properties set QueueExtraThreads = 300;.

qas.question: How can you determine if a table is a 'Temporary' table type?

answers.text:
You can verify if a table was created as a 'Temporary' table using the following methods: 

1)Utilizing db2cat:
Run the db2cat utility with the respective database name, table name, and schema as inputs to see if the returned result shows a table type of "temporary".
Example command: db2cat -db <database_name> -n <table_name> -s <schema_name> -t | grep "Temporary table"

Sample output: 
----------------------
Connecting to the Database.
Database Connection Successful.
Temporary table : 0
----------------------
A 'Temporary table' value of '0' signifies the table was not created as a temporary type. If it returns '1', that means the table was indeed created as a temporary type. 

2)Using db2look:
Leverage the db2look command to obtain the DDL information to verify the table's intended type.
Example command: db2look -d <database_name> -t <table_name> -e -o <output_filename.out>

qas.question: What does a 'Temporary table' value of '0' signify?

answers.text: A 'Temporary table' value of '0' signifies the table was not created as a temporary type.

qas.question: How does DB2 V9 check a table's type?

answers.text: Starting from DB2 V9, the TYPE column in SYSCAT.TABLES table was adopted to check a table's type.

qas.question: What does it mean when the 'Temporary table' value returns '1'?

answers.text: If it returns '1', that means the table was indeed created as a temporary type.

qas.question: Do temporary tables support the ALTER statement?

answers.text: Temporary tables do not support the ALTER statement

paragraphs.context:
TECHNOTE (FAQ)
QUESTION: How to determine if a table was built with TEMPORARY table type?
ANSWER: You can verify if a table was created as a 'Temporary' table using the following methods: 

1)Utilizing db2cat:
Run the db2cat utility with the respective database name, table name, and schema as inputs to see if the returned result shows a table type of "temporary".
Example command: db2cat -db <database_name> -n <table_name> -s <schema_name> -t | grep "Temporary table"

Sample output: 
----------------------
Connecting to the Database.
Database Connection Successful.
Temporary table : 0
----------------------
A 'Temporary table' value of '0' signifies the table was not created as a temporary type. If it returns '1', that means the table was indeed created as a temporary type. 

2)Using db2look:
Leverage the db2look command to obtain the DDL information to verify the table's intended type.
Example command: db2look -d <database_name> -t <table_name> -e -o <output_filename.out> 

NOTE: Temporary tables do not support the ALTER statement, thus these tables are not listed when executing the above commands. 

Starting from DB2 V9, the TYPE column in SYSCAT.TABLES table was adopted to check a table's type. In DB2 V8, this column has deprecated and will always return a value of 0 for the table type. 

RELATED INFORMATION: TEMPORARY Table Type [http://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSAE4W_7.1.0/com.ibm.etools.iseries.langref2.doc/rbafzmst484.htm].

qas.question: What is Daylight Saving Time?

answers.text: Daylight Saving Time (DST) is the practice of setting the clock ahead by one hour during the warmer part of the year, so evenings have more daylight and mornings have less.

qas.question: Could the transition to Daylight Saving Time affect time-sensitive applications?

answers.text: This transition could potentially affect time-sensitive applications.

qas.question: How does WebAdmin handle the change to Daylight Saving Time?

answers.text: The transition to and from Daylight Saving Time does not interfere with WebAdmin's operations.

qas.question: Do any proactive measures need to be taken for WebAdmin during the transition to Daylight Saving Time?

answers.text: No proactive measures need to be taken, as the system automatically adjusts to the time change.

qas.question: Will the Daylight Saving Time transition affect the operations of WebAdmin?

answers.text: The transition to and from Daylight Saving Time does not interfere with WebAdmin's operations.

paragraphs.context:
configure; daylight savings; DST TECHNOTE (FAQ)

QUESTION: How does the transition to Daylight Saving Time affect the operations of WebAdmin?

CAUSE: Daylight Saving Time (DST) is the practice of setting the clock ahead by one hour during the warmer part of the year, so evenings have more daylight and mornings have less. This transition could potentially affect time-sensitive applications.

ANSWER: The transition to and from Daylight Saving Time does not interfere with WebAdmin's operations. No proactive measures need to be taken, as the system automatically adjusts to the time change.

qas.question: What causes the error in the system according to the context?

answers.text: The issue is occurring due to the failure of initialization during system boot. This causes the configuration task to be unable to interact with the needed software during the update process, which in turn, generates the error.

qas.question: What needs to be done to fix the issue?

answers.text:
Please follow these steps in the WAS Management Dashboard... Applications > WebSphere Business Applications > JavaDataStore > Adjust Target application status > Mark the WebSphere_Portal server > Click on Activate Auto Start > Save modifications > restart System.

After implementing these modifications, please try the configuration update once more.

qas.question: What is the solution if my Oracle SID or SERVICE NAME isn't correctly recognized by my TNS Listener?

paragraphs.context:
TECHNOTE (FAQ)
QUESTION 
Why isn't my TNS Listener responding correctly? The error messages on my logs seem to suggest some connectivity issues. My server logs display the message - "Listener refused connection with the following error: ORA-12519, TNS:no appropriate service handler found" and from my Oracle database logs, I keep seeing "TNS Listener could not find available handler with matching protocol stack"

CAUSE
One reason for these errors could potentially be that your Oracle SID (System Identifier) or SERVICE NAME isn't correctly recognized by your listener. This can often happen when the Oracle service isn't correctly configured in your listener.ora configuration file.

ANSWER
To resolve such issues, confirm the SID or SERVICE NAME for your Oracle instance and ensure it is correctly defined in the listener.ora file. You can also make certain that the listener service is running and properly configured. Once corrected, listener should identify the service and the connection issue should be resolved.

qas.question: What tasks is the user experiencing issues with?

answers.text: 1. Run Data Configuration Assistant 2. Grant data access permissions 3. Update Entity Mode to the Master Data Management mode for an existing project in Data Access Manager.

qas.question: What error messages does the user encounter?

answers.text: 1. MDM-DAT-0008 Unable to process data access request, lack of sufficient permissions. 2. MDM-DAT-0008 Data access request failed due to insufficient permissions. MDM-ERR-2092 An error has transpired.

qas.question: What could be the potential cause of these problems?

answers.text: One potential cause could be that the user lacks the necessary "Configure data access permissions" capability.

qas.question: How can we resolve this problem?

answers.text: Grant the user the essential "Configure data access permissions" capability.

qas.question: What steps should be followed to grant the user the essential "Configure data access permissions" capability?

answers.text: 1. In MDM Connection, navigate to 'Launch > IBM MDM Administration'. 2. Click on the 'Security' tab. 3. Select 'Capabilities' on the left side. 4. Click "Actions" > Set Properties next to "Configure data access permissions". 5. Click on the 'Permissions' tab. 6. Add the necessary user, group or role to the capability granting them Read, Execute and Traverse permissions.

paragraphs.context: MDM; Configuring data access permissions TECHNOTE (TROUBLESHOOTING) PROBLEM (ABSTRACT) User is experiencing issues with executing the following tasks:  1. Run Data Configuration Assistant 2. Grant data access permissions 3. Update Entity Mode to the Master Data Management mode for an existing project in Data Access Manager. SYMPTOM User encounters one of the following error messages: 1. MDM-DAT-0008 Unable to process data access request, lack of sufficient permissions. 2. MDM-DAT-0008 Data access request failed due to insufficient permissions. MDM-ERR-2092 An error has transpired. Please reach out to your administrator. The complete error is logged by CDM with SecureErrorID... 3. MDM-DAT-0008 Execution of task for data access failed. Insufficient permissions... CAUSE One potential cause could be that the user lacks the necessary "Configure data access permissions" capability. RESOLVING THE PROBLEM Grant the user the essential "Configure data access permissions" capability. Steps: 1. In MDM Connection, navigate to 'Launch > IBM MDM Administration'. 2. Click on the 'Security' tab. 3. Select 'Capabilities' on the left side. 4. Click "Actions" > Set Properties next to "Configure data access permissions". 5. Click on the 'Permissions' tab. 6. Add the necessary user, group or role to the capability granting them Read, Execute and Traverse permissions. RELATED INFORMATION Configuring Data Access in Data Access Manager [http://ibmurl.hursley.ibm.com/3PJO].

QUESTION 
How to style the data of an XML-type ruleset parameter in the RESTful request to a Supervised Transparent Decision Service (STDS) ?

REASON
As pointed out in the guide for STDS, XML parameters are illustrated by a string in the WSDL document.

SOLUTION
The data of the parameter refers to the XML data that corresponds to your input parameter XML, either forwarded in a CDATA segment or by transforming the XML unique characters (swapping <, >, ", ' and & with <, >, ", ' and &). qas.question: What problem do SQL Manager 2007 users report?

answers.text: difficulties when trying to connect to SQL Server lower level versions (2005 or 2008).

qas.question: What is the symptom of this problem?

answers.text: Unsuccessful attempts to connect to SQL Server 2005 ,2006 or 2008 from SQL Manager 2007.

qas.question: What is the cause of the connectivity issues between SQL Manager 2007 and SQL Server 2008?

answers.text: SQL Manager 2007 comes packaged with SQL Server 2007 and due to known vulnerabilities has SSLv3 disabled. However, SQL Server 2008 and earlier editions default to using SSLv3 causing SQL Manager 2007 connectivity issues.

qas.question: What changes should be made in the SQL_HOME/Server/SQLProfile/config/cells/SQLNodeCell/security.xml file to resolve the issue?

answers.text: Locate sslProtocol and replace "SSL_TLS" with "TLS". Also, find ssl.protocol and change the value from "SSL" to "TLS".

paragraphs.context:
SQL Manager 2007; connect; SSL ; TLS TECHNOTE (GUIDANCE)
PROBLEM(OVERVIEW)
SQL Manager 2007 users report difficulties when trying to connect to SQL Server lower level versions (2005 or 2008). 

SYMPTOM
Unsuccessful attempts to connect to SQL Server 2005 ,2006 or 2008 from SQL Manager 2007. Check the SQLManager.log for error: SSL1080: javax.net.ssl.SSLHandshakeException - The Client and Server could not agree on the desired security level. Reason: Server picked SSLv3, but that protocol version is not enabled or unsupported by the client. javax.net.ssl.SSLHandshakeException: Server selected SSLv3, but that protocol version is not enabled or supported by the client.

CAUSE
SQL Manager 2007 comes packaged with SQL Server 2007 and due to known vulnerabilities has SSLv3 disabled. However, SQL Server 2008 and earlier editions default to using SSLv3 causing SQL Manager 2007 connectivity issues. 

RESOLVING THE ISSUE
This can be resolved by configuring your SQL Server engines to utilize TLS instead of SSL: 

Back up and modify the file: SQL_HOME/Server/SQLProfile/config/cells/SQLNodeCell/security.xml. Locate sslProtocol and replace "SSL_TLS" with "TLS". Also, find ssl.protocol and change the value from "SSL" to "TLS". 

Back up and edit: SQL_HOME/Server/SQLProfile/properties/ssl.client.props. Locate com.microsoft.ssl.protocol=SSL and replace with com.microsoft.ssl.protocol=TLS. 

Stop and restart SQL Server. 

Be aware that your engines are now utilizing TLS and any SQL Manager 2006 or 2005 installations needing to connect to those engines should be reconfigured to use TLS, in the same method as mentioned above but with the same changes in these copies of security.xml and ssl.client.props files:

SQL_HOME/JazzSM/profile/config/cells/JazzSMNode01Cell/security.xml 

SQL_HOME/JazzSM/profile/properties/ssl.client.props 

SQL_HOME/JazzSM/profile/temp/ssl.client.props 

It's important to note since you're now configured with TLS the SQL Server Engine dynamics can be affected. Refer to technote 1689332 for additional details.

qas.question: What is the issue discovered in Maximo?

answers.text: The MAXMESSAGE value for group session and key password could not be identified.

qas.question: What error message does IBM DB2 give?

answers.text: No sanctioned routine termed "ISNULL" of type "FUNCTION" that has compatible arguments was discovered.

qas.question: How to diagnose this issue in IBM DB2 database?

answers.text: Connect to database backend and examine the result of this query:- select propvalue from maximo.maxpropvalue where propname='mxe.db.format.nullvalue'; If you are using DB2 database, the result should be 'COALESCE'.

qas.question: What is the resolution strategy for this problem in IBM DB2, Oracle, and SQL Server?

answers.text: For IBM DB2, the value is COALESCE, and altering the default value is not permitted. For Oracle, the value is NVL, and switching the default value is not permitted.For SQL Server, the value must be defined as ISNULL.

qas.question: What actions should be taken to rectify this error?

answers.text: Ensure MXServer is halted. Connect to database back-end and modify mxe.db.format.nullvalue by executing following query :- update maximo.maxpropvalue set propvalue='COALESCE' where propname='mxe.db.format.nullvalue'; Restart MXServer afterwards..

SYMPTOM[FAILURE] BMXAA6578E - A message for group session and key password could not be traced.com.ibm.db2.jcc.c.SqlException: No sanctioned routine termed "ISNULL" of type "FUNCTION" that has compatible arguments was discovered.at com.ibm.db2.jcc.c.fg.e(fg.java:1697)at com.ibm.db2.jcc.c.fg.a(fg.java:1307)at com.ibm.db2.jcc.b.gb.g(gb.java:150)at com.ibm.db2.jcc.b.gb.a(gb.java:49)at com.ibm.db2.jcc.b.w.a(w.java:44)at com.ibm.db2.jcc.b.vb.g(vb.java:149)at com.ibm.db2.jcc.c.fg.n(fg.java:1278)at com.ibm.db2.jcc.c.fg.a(fg.java:1933)at com.ibm.db2.jcc.c.fg.a(fg.java:563)at com.ibm.db2.jcc.c.fg.executeQuery(fg.java:547)at psdi.server.MXServer.getMessage(MXServer.java:5463)at psdi.server.MXServer.getMessages(MXServer.java:5639)ENVIRONMENTIBM DB2 database DIAGNOSTIC ANALYSISConnect to database backend and examine the result of this query:- select propvalue from maximo.maxpropvalue where propname='mxe.db.format.nullvalue'; If you are using DB2 database, the result should be 'COALESCE'.RESOLUTION STRATEGYFor IBM DB2, the value is COALESCE, and altering the default value is not permitted. For Oracle, the value is NVL, and switching the default value is not permitted.For SQL Server, the value must be defined as ISNULL.Ensure MXServer is halted. Connect to database back-end and modify mxe.db.format.nullvalue by executing following query :- update maximo.maxpropvalue set propvalue='COALESCE' where propname='mxe.db.format.nullvalue'; Restart MXServer afterwards..

qas.question: What is wrong with the automated deployment process of a Java application?

answers.text: The deployment procedure is stuck in "Awaiting Approval" state for an indefinite period.

qas.question: What happens when passwords are reset?

answers.text: After resetting, the same error appears stating that the password provided is incorrect.

qas.question: What is the symptom of this issue?

answers.text: The given password is incorrect. ERR-ADM-3403 The admin account data is incorrect, or it is lacking in the Deployment Manager.

qas.question: What is the cause of the issue?

answers.text: Deployment Manager corrupted.

qas.question: How can we resolve the problem?

answers.text:
Deleting the ADM* tables using this script: Steps: 
1. Stop the Java App Service
2. Make a physical backup of the Deployment Manager or Alert database
3. Select the particular folder for your Deployment Manager or alert database under <deploy>/settings/schemas/alerts/<dbtype>/
4. Run ADM_DROP_<dbtype>.sql on the Deployment Manager or alert database 
5. Restart Java App Services. If deleting the ADM* tables doesn't resolve the problem, then restore the Deployment Manager or alert store from the previous backup version.

paragraphs.context:
TECHNOTE (TROUBLESHOOTING)
ISSUE (SUMMARY)
The automated deployment process of a Java application does not work. The deployment procedure is stuck in "Awaiting Approval" state for an indefinite period. - Resetting passwords does not resolve the problem. After resetting, the same error appears stating that the password provided is incorrect.- The "Allow Administrator approval" option also doesn't solve the problem.
SYMPTOM
The given password is incorrect. ERR-ADM-3403 The admin account data is incorrect, or it is lacking in the Deployment Manager. APP-AAA-0102 Authentication failed. User must choose a region.... Your session is terminated. Choose a region for identification.
CAUSE
Deployment Manager corrupted.
RESOLUTION 
Deleting the ADM* tables using this script: Steps: 
1. Stop the Java App Service
2. Make a physical backup of the Deployment Manager or Alert database
3. Select the particular folder for your Deployment Manager or alert database under <deploy>/settings/schemas/alerts/<dbtype>/
4. Run ADM_DROP_<dbtype>.sql on the Deployment Manager or alert database 
5. Restart Java App Services. If deleting the ADM* tables doesn't resolve the problem, then restore the Deployment Manager or alert store from the previous backup version.
RELATED INFORMATION
Java Application Deployment Equivalent [http://www.oracle.com/support/docview.wss?uid=swg22001203].

answers.text: We recommend deleting the TMRM parameter 'TDS_AUTHENTICATION_ISSUE' from the TDSENV, then restart the TMRM and make sure that all users are able to log on.

paragraphs.context:

The TMRM logs register the following error:

qas.question: How can one identify the current operating state of an application deployed on a particular WebSphere Application Server?

answers.text: use the WebSphere Application Server Admin Console and navigate through the following path: Servers --> Application Servers --> Server_Name (your server) --> Applications --> Application Types --> WebSphere enterprise applications --> Application_Name --> Runtime tab --> Module/view.

qas.question: What is the path to access the JDBC Provider configuration for enterprise applications?

answers.text:
use the WebSphere Application Server Admin Console and navigate through the following path: Servers --> Application Servers --> Server_Name (your server) --> Applications --> Application Types --> WebSphere enterprise applications --> Application_Name --> Runtime tab --> Module/view. 

Similarly, to access the JDBC Provider configuration for your enterprise applications, use the WebSphere Application Server Admin Console and follow the below path: Resources --> JDBC --> Data sources --> ds_name (for example) --> Connection pools.

qas.question: What is the problem when implementing the IBM FileNet Content Manager?

answers.text: the generated war and ear files appear to be just a few kilobytes in size including the create_j2eeclient_war.sh and create_j2eeclient_ear.sh files.

qas.question: What error message is typically seen when this issue arises?

answers.text: ERROR: "create_j2eeclient_war.sh[5]: cd: ContentManager: [no such file or directory]".

qas.question: How is the issue resolved?

answers.text: To rectify this issue, deactivate the CDPATH OS environment variable when formulating the IBM FileNet Content Manager war and ear files.

qas.question: What does the CDPATH environment variable do?

answers.text: The CDPATH environment variable serves to define the foundation directory for the CD command

paragraphs.context: TECHNOTE (GUIDE) PROBLEM(ABSTRACT) When implementing the IBM FileNet Content Manager using either Content Platform Engine Client Files setup or the IBM Case Manager's "Deploy IBM FileNet Content Manager" configuration task, the generated war and ear files appear to be just a few kilobytes in size including the create_j2eeclient_war.sh and create_j2eeclient_ear.sh files. IDENTIFYING THE ISSUE The ceclient_install_log or warerr.log file will highlight this error: ERROR: "create_j2eeclient_war.sh[5]: cd: ContentManager: [no such file or directory]".  Trying to apply the created archive file to the IBM WebSphere Application Server results in another error. IWAE0006E Archive is not a valid WAR File due to the deployment descriptor can not be located (case sensitive): WEB-INF/web.xml RESOLVING THE ISSUE The create_j2eeclient_war.sh script that formulates the j2eeclient.war file includes a change directory (CD) OS command enabling the Content Manager directory to be part of the archive. This CD function fails with a "No such file or directory" trouble and can be attributable to the CDPATH OS environment variable being activated. The CDPATH environment variable serves to define the foundation directory for the CD command, and setting this CDPATH can cause CD commands in scripts to shift to unexpected directories. For instance, the error below suggests the OS is unable to locate the Content Manager Directory from the main file system instead of the anticipated "<ContentManager_install_directory>/IBM/FileNet/j2eeclient/" directory. ERROR: "create_j2eeclient_war.sh[5]: cd: ContentManager: [No such file or directory]" To rectify this issue, deactivate the CDPATH OS environment variable when formulating the IBM FileNet Content Manager war and ear files.

qas.question: What problem is being faced when executing the "run-appsvr-config" task via the ConfigEngine?

answers.text:
you receive the following error:
Command to run is: java com.tivoli.pd.jcfg.AppSvrCfg -action config -admin_id sec_master -admin_pwd ****** -appsvr_id myappserverid -port 7623 -mode remote -policysvr <hostname>:7535:1 -authzsvr <hostname>:7536:1 -cfg_file C:\IBM\WebSphere\AppServer\java\jre/PdPerm.properties -key_file C:\IBM\WebSphere\AppServer\java\jre/lib/security/pdperm.ks
[java] Exception in thread "main" 
[java] [[java] HPDMG0623W The authorization server is not available.

qas.question: What environment does this problem occur in?

answers.text: Configuring WebSphere® Portal 6.1 with Tivoli® Access Manager 6.0

qas.question: What does the error message refer to?

answers.text: The error message refers to the unavailability of the authorization server as pointed by authzsvr parameter used in the AppSvrCfg command.

qas.question: How can the problem be resolved?

answers.text: To avoid the error, ensure that the authorization server is up and running before executing the run-appsvr-config task.

qas.question: What related information is provided?

answers.text: Updating the AMJRTE properties file

paragraphs.context:
TAM; run-appsvr-config; appsvr; HPDMG0623W; AMJRTE TECHNOTE (TROUBLESHOOTING)
PROBLEM
When executing the "run-appsvr-config" task via the ConfigEngine to update the AMJRTE properties file, you receive the following error:
Command to run is: java com.tivoli.pd.jcfg.AppSvrCfg -action config -admin_id sec_master -admin_pwd ****** -appsvr_id myappserverid -port 7623 -mode remote -policysvr <hostname>:7535:1 -authzsvr <hostname>:7536:1 -cfg_file C:\IBM\WebSphere\AppServer\java\jre/PdPerm.properties -key_file C:\IBM\WebSphere\AppServer\java\jre/lib/security/pdperm.ks
[java] Exception in thread "main" 
[java] [[java] HPDMG0623W The authorization server is not available. 
[java] ] 
[java] at com.tivoli.pd.jutil.bo.a(bo.java:98)
ENVIRONMENT
Configuring WebSphere® Portal 6.1 with Tivoli® Access Manager 6.0
DIAGNOSING THE PROBLEM 
The error message refers to the unavailability of the authorization server as pointed by authzsvr parameter used in the AppSvrCfg command. The value for this server is set via the following parameter in wkplc_comp.properties: wp.ac.impl.PDServerName
RESOLVING THE PROBLEM 
To avoid the error, ensure that the authorization server is up and running before executing the run-appsvr-config task. If not, start the authzsvr with the appropriate command.
RELATED INFORMATION
#Updating the AMJRTE properties file [http://publib.boulder.ibm.com/infocenter/wpdoc/v6r1m0/index.jsp?topic=/com.ibm.wp.ent.doc/security/cfg_tam_auth.html] *  *.

qas.question: What is the issue that is observed?

answers.text: The generated .pdf files via LegacyApp cannot be opened as a PDF document but rather as a text file.

qas.question: What is the root cause of the issue?

answers.text: The incorrect Mime Type was assigned when generating the .pdf documents via LegacyApp.

qas.question: How can you troubleshoot this issue?

answers.text: Verify if the .pdf document with the Mime Type "application/pdf" opens correctly within LegacyApp.

qas.question: How can we solve the issue?

answers.text: Update the settings in LegacyAppConfig.xml to map the extension to the correct mime type:

qas.question: What happens when attempting to open the .pdf file via LegacyApp?

answers.text: When creating a .pdf file via LegacyApp, the Mime Type displayed is "text/pdf" in the File Properties and Content Details.

paragraphs.context:
TECH NOTE (SOFTWARE ISSUE)
THIS RESOURCE AVAILABLE IN: US English
ISSUE (SUMMARY)
The generated .pdf files via LegacyApp cannot be opened as a PDF document but rather as a text file.
SYMPTOMS
The .pdf files can be accessed as PDF from other applications and outside of LegacyApp but not from within the LegacyApp.
ROOT CAUSE
The incorrect Mime Type was assigned when generating the .pdf documents via LegacyApp.
TROUBLESHOOTING THE ISSUE
When exporting a .pdf document via another application, the Mime Type displayed under the File Properties and Content Details is "application/pdf". 

When creating a .pdf file via LegacyApp, the Mime Type displayed is "text/pdf" in the File Properties and Content Details. 

Verify if the .pdf document with the Mime Type "application/pdf" opens correctly within LegacyApp.
SOLUTION
Update the settings in LegacyAppConfig.xml to map the extension to the correct mime type: 

<mime-mapping>
<extension>pdf</extension>
<mime-type>application/pdf</mime-type>
</mime-mapping>
